intro: Lophocarpus tonquinensis, commonly known as the Tonkin mallow, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some botanical gardens and is of interest to researchers studying tropical flora.
